question:
Consider the following statements in context with the motion of the Sunflowers in response to Sun’s movement (Heliotropism):
  1. The Phenomenon is more pronounced in grown up flowers in comparison to young buds
  2. The Sodium Ions play a very important role in Heliotropism
  3. Heliotropism is mostly ascribed to the “Blue” segment of Sun Light
Which among the above statements is/ are correct?
explanation: Heliotropism is mostly ascribed to the “Blue” segment of Sun Light. It is the diurnal motion or seasonal motion of plant parts in response to the direction of the sun.
